subject: Re: [junit] No assertEquals(double, double)?
msgSnippet: ... It s in there as: assertEquals(double expected, double actual, double delta); Mike -- Mike Clark Clarkware Consulting, Inc. http://www.clarkware.com
messageBody:
Berin Loritsch wrote:

>I was writing a testcase, and realized that with all the assertion
>methods
>in junit.framework.Assert, there is no assertEquals(double, double).
>There
>are versions for integers, longs, shorts, chars, Obejcts, etc. Is this
>just
>an oversight?
>

It's in there as:

assertEquals(double expected, double actual, double delta);

Mike

--
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
http://www.clarkware.com
720.851.2014
